intro: Semenovia bucharica, commonly known as the Bukharan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Semenovia bucharica is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
